alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Lackawanna; Susquehanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:36PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Susquehanna, northwestern Lackawanna, east central Bradford and eastern Wyoming Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 336 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Auburn Center, or 9 miles east of Wyalusing, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Falls, Tunkhannock, Springville, Glenburn, Dalton, Factoryville, Mehoopany, Nicholson, La Plume and Meshoppen. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 206 and 211. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
